subject: Re: Testing Private Methods
msgSnippet: ... I have a section in the JUnit chapter in my TDD book on the topic. I m thinking maybe it should be the next Coad Letter issue. I ll try to do justice to
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbr@d...> wrote:
> So said Mike Colbert <mbcolbert@y...> on 2002-12-13

> >My reply was a bit hasty and poorly formed ... Let me rephrase my
> >question. Why is it better, easier, more practical, pragmatic,
> >and/or more productive to not associate TestCases with classes in a
> >TDD environment? Or should I wait for the newsletter?
>
> A TestCase object is a test fixture. This is definitely an article that
> either Dave or I need to write.
>
> Dave?

I have a section in the JUnit chapter in my TDD book on the topic.
I'm thinking maybe it should be the next Coad Letter issue.

I'll try to do justice to the topic once I'm back at the hotel and
post the first draft of the results here.

Dave
